svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
December 9, 2023" date: "2023-12-09"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade (meta EIP7569 )
* Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Recap by Tim Beiko . Notes from
Tim Beiko and Christine Kim : Devnet-12: issues being found & fixed; Prysm expect to
join in 1-2 weeks Goerli ~300 node shadow fork planned before end of December Goerli
upgrade to be scheduled in January to test 3/6 (target/max) blobs Community can propose
EIPs for next upgrade , to be discussed in January
Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Recap by Tim Beiko . Notes from
Tim Beiko and Christine Kim :
* Devnet-12: issues being found & fixed; Prysm expect to join in 1-2 weeks
Devnet-12: issues being found & fixed; Prysm expect to join in 1-2 weeks
* Goerli ~300 node shadow fork planned before end of December
Goerli ~300 node shadow fork planned before end of December
* Goerli upgrade to be scheduled in January to test 3/6 (target/max) blobs
Goerli upgrade to be scheduled in January to test 3/6 (target/max) blobs
* Community can propose EIPs for next upgrade , to be discussed in January
Community can propose EIPs for next upgrade , to be discussed in January
* Consensus-specs v1.4.0-beta.5 : clarifies when clients can serve blocks & sidecars
byRoot
Consensus-specs v1.4.0-beta.5 : clarifies when clients can serve blocks & sidecars
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* 🚨 Lido at 32.03% is far too close to 33.3% threshold
🚨 Lido at 32.03% is far too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~84%
supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split Consensus layer: Prysm 41% &
Lighthouse 34%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~84% supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
Execution layer: Geth ~84% supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
* Consensus layer: Prysm 41% & Lighthouse 34%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean
loss of finality
Consensus layer: Prysm 41% & Lighthouse 34%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss
of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America & Europe
Layer 1
* Reth (node) crawler : ~19k active nodes found using UDP & inbound TCP
Reth (node) crawler : ~19k active nodes found using UDP & inbound TCP
* Erigon 2024 roadmap: Erigon++ (evmone, SilkRPC C++ components), Caplin full archive
node, Erigon v3 & Otterscan (enhanced with Erigon v3 & Beacon Chain capability via
Caplin)
Erigon 2024 roadmap: Erigon++ (evmone, SilkRPC C++ components), Caplin full archive
* Lightclients: EIP3074 (AUTH & AUTHCALL opcodes) would allow EOAs to be used within
ERC4337 (Account Abstraction using alt transaction pool)
Lightclients: EIP3074 (AUTH & AUTHCALL opcodes) would allow EOAs to be used within
For Stakers
* Rescue Node adds support for solo stakers, fallback node for temporary access in
emergencies/maintenance
Client releases
* Execution layer: Erigon v2.55.1 : patch Nethermind v1.23.0 : OP Stack support (Canyon
upgrade not yet supported), initialize DB using snapshot and reduced memory consumption
when overloaded with CL requests Reth v0.1.0-alpha.13 : fix block commit times for full
node & heavy RPC tracing users
* Erigon v2.55.1 : patch
Erigon v2.55.1 : patch
* Nethermind v1.23.0 : OP Stack support (Canyon upgrade not yet supported), initialize
DB using snapshot and reduced memory consumption when overloaded with CL requests
Nethermind v1.23.0 : OP Stack support (Canyon upgrade not yet supported), initialize DB
using snapshot and reduced memory consumption when overloaded with CL requests
* Reth v0.1.0-alpha.13 : fix block commit times for full node & heavy RPC tracing users
Reth v0.1.0-alpha.13 : fix block commit times for full node & heavy RPC tracing users
Research
* Timing games : implications of proposers delaying block publication to increase MEV
and pros & cons of possible mitigations
Timing games : implications of proposers delaying block publication to increase MEV and
pros & cons of possible mitigations
* CEX<>DEX arbitrage empirical analysis
CEX<>DEX arbitrage empirical analysis
Layer 2
* L2BEAT liveness dashboard adds intervals of proof submissions for zk rollups
EIPs/Standards
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7570 : Security token interface for confidentiality &
legal status transparency ERC7571 : Shadow events ERC7572 : Contract-level metadata via
contractURI
* ERC7570 : Security token interface for confidentiality & legal status transparency
ERC7570 : Security token interface for confidentiality & legal status transparency
* ERC7571 : Shadow events
ERC7571 : Shadow events
* ERC7572 : Contract-level metadata via contractURI
ERC7572 : Contract-level metadata via contractURI
Stuff for developers
* Solidity developer survey 2023 : feedback to the Solidity team
Solidity developer survey 2023 : feedback to the Solidity team
* Shadow logs: add custom events for contracts to offchain shadow fork, access via RPC
Shadow logs: add custom events for contracts to offchain shadow fork, access via RPC
* Foundry Go differential fuzzing template to compare Solidity & Go implementations
Foundry Go differential fuzzing template to compare Solidity & Go implementations
* Wagmi-permit : sign ERC2612/DAI permits with viem/wagmi
Wagmi-permit : sign ERC2612/DAI permits with viem/wagmi
* Guide to web3.py typed data message signing
Guide to web3.py typed data message signing
* EF Python team: Ethereum Python user survey
EF Python team: Ethereum Python user survey
* OpenZeppelin access manager explorer for contract permissions
OpenZeppelin access manager explorer for contract permissions
* Protolambda’s Grug wallet design
Protolambda’s Grug wallet design
Security
* OpenZeppelin : contracts integrating both Multicall & ERC2771 vulnerable to address
spoofing Thirdweb vulnerability , impacted pre-built contract deployers need to
mitigate
* Thirdweb vulnerability , impacted pre-built contract deployers need to mitigate
Ecosystem
* Blocknative Ethernow transaction explorer (including live transaction pool), desktop
only
Blocknative Ethernow transaction explorer (including live transaction pool), desktop
* Parsec block explorer, supports mainnet & L2s, transaction heat map and custom
layouts for address types
Parsec block explorer, supports mainnet & L2s, transaction heat map and custom layouts
for address types
* MEV searching strategy: blind arbs on private orderflow
MEV searching strategy: blind arbs on private orderflow
* EF run a node grantees : 35 recipients from 23 countries
EF run a node grantees : 35 recipients from 23 countries
* Optimism’s RetroPGF3 voting ended , 502 projects qualified for share of 30M OP
Optimism’s RetroPGF3 voting ended , 502 projects qualified for share of 30M OP
Enterprise
* Societe Generale issued EUR 10M green bond onchain
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 21.4 to 144.2 gwei, with 45.2 gwei average Zero net
issuance currently at 21.8 gwei 17.6k ETH net burn this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 21.4 to 144.2 gwei, with 45.2 gwei average
* Zero net issuance currently at 21.8 gwei
Zero net issuance currently at 21.8 gwei
* 17.6k ETH net burn this week
17.6k ETH net burn this week
* ETHUSD : $2,086 - $2,385, currently $2,361
ETHUSD : $2,086 - $2,385, currently $2,361
* ETHBTC : currently 0.053 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.053 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* Safe RecoveryHub : set multisig recoverer(s), recovery attempt can be canceled within
review window
Safe RecoveryHub : set multisig recoverer(s), recovery attempt can be canceled within
* Coinbase Wallet links : send USDC via a shareable link, returned if not claimed
within 2 weeks
Coinbase Wallet links : send USDC via a shareable link, returned if not claimed within
2 weeks
* Matcha cross chain swaps live on mainnet, L2s & sidechains
Matcha cross chain swaps live on mainnet, L2s & sidechains
* Proof of P2P : soulbound NFT, zk proof of unique human with P2P account, requires
Venmo
Proof of P2P : soulbound NFT, zk proof of unique human with P2P account, requires Venmo
* Optimism We ❤️ the Art (NFT creator contest) extended to January 8
Optimism We ❤️ the Art (NFT creator contest) extended to January 8
Job Listings
* Enya Labs: Lead Security Engineer , Sr. Fullstack Dev (with Go exp), BizDev
Enya Labs: Lead Security Engineer , Sr. Fullstack Dev (with Go exp), BizDev
* Senior Operations Security Expert wanted by EF
Senior Operations Security Expert wanted by EF
* ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* Russian owner of Bitzlato exchange pleaded guilty to unlicensed money transmitting
[back in January US DoJ pre-announced enforcement action ]
Russian owner of Bitzlato exchange pleaded guilty to unlicensed money transmitting
* Platypus hackers acquitted by Paris court, as deemed smart contract interaction
Platypus hackers acquitted by Paris court, as deemed smart contract interaction
General
* Governments obtained push notification metadata from Apple (subpoena) & Google (court
order)
Governments obtained push notification metadata from Apple (subpoena) & Google (court
* Security self audit: Telegram and Google account
Security self audit: Telegram and Google account
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-december-9-2023
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Jan 15 – EF’s Next Billion fellowship cohort 4 deadline
Jan 15 – EF’s Next Billion fellowship cohort 4 deadline
* Feb 2-4 – ETH Cinco de Mayo hackathon (Cholula, Puebla)
Feb 2-4 – ETH Cinco de Mayo hackathon (Cholula, Puebla)
* Feb 23-Mar 3 – ETHDenver BUIDLWeek & hackathon
Feb 23-Mar 3 – ETHDenver BUIDLWeek & hackathon
* Mar 13-14 – ETHLatam (San Pedro Sula, Honduras)
Mar 13-14 – ETHLatam (San Pedro Sula, Honduras)
* Mar 15-17 – ETHGlobal London
Mar 15-17 – ETHGlobal London
* Mar 19-21 – ETH Canal (Panama City, Panamá)
Mar 19-21 – ETH Canal (Panama City, Panamá)
* Mar 21-24 – ETHTaipei conference & hackathon
Mar 21-24 – ETHTaipei conference & hackathon
* Mar 27-30 – ETH Bucharest hackathon & conference
Mar 27-30 – ETH Bucharest hackathon & conference
* Apr 5-26 – ETHGlobal Scaling Ethereum (virtual)
Apr 5-26 – ETHGlobal Scaling Ethereum (virtual)
* Apr 5-7 – EthereumZuri.ch conference & hackathon
Apr 5-7 – EthereumZuri.ch conference & hackathon
* May 3-5 – ETHGlobal Sydney
May 3-5 – ETHGlobal Sydney
* May 21-23 – DappCon (Berlin)
May 21-23 – DappCon (Berlin)
* May 24-26 – ETHBerlin
May 24-26 – ETHBerlin
* Jul 8-11 – EthCC (Brussels)
Jul 8-11 – EthCC (Brussels)
* Jul 12-14 – ETHGlobal Brussels
Jul 12-14 – ETHGlobal Brussels
* Aug 23-Sep 13 – ETHGlobal ETHOnline (virtual)
Aug 23-Sep 13 – ETHGlobal ETHOnline (virtual)
* Sep 20-22 – ETHGlobal Singapore
Sep 20-22 – ETHGlobal Singapore
* Oct 18-20 – ETHGlobal San Francisco
Oct 18-20 – ETHGlobal San Francisco
* Nov – ETHGlobal DevCon
Nov – ETHGlobal DevCon

Week in Ethereum News
